name: Hotel Straf

reviews.text: I decided to chose the Hotel Straf based on some of the more positive reviews on TripAdvisor and Frommer's Italy. I must say that I was generally disappointed. Location is faultless - right within the heart of busy busy Milan and within a stone's throw from the Duomo.
reviews.title: More style than substance ...

reviews.text: The hotel is generally modern, with a "cold, Zen-like" feel in terms of design. Expect your room to be mainly black to grey in colour all over. The bathrooms are stylish and minimalist but clearly impractical in terms of design. No shelves, small sink and the shower area has no door nor curtains so the water will splash everywhere on the floor if you are not careful when you shower.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers Milan style

reviews.text: The beds are however, relatively firm and comfortable and the sheets are clean and soft.
reviews.title: Great location, cool decor, average service.

reviews.text: There is Wifi access throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Soo Convenient !

reviews.text: Breakfast was really very "basic" with a limited selection of fruits and breads and pastries and some cereals. The rest will need to be ordered and paid for additionally.
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the Straf is excellently located and, at first glance, a lovely "design" hotel, it really was not that pleasant of a place to stay. My primary complaint is that the rooms and lobby are so focused on "design" (and I use quotes sarcastically) that comfort and function are not really even considered. For instance, in the bathroom, there are no towel rack and no countertop to put toiletries on (just a lone-standing basin sink). The shower and tub controls were about as cryptic as I have ever encountered. The rooms have many lights to accommodate many moods -- but this comes with a tradeoff: about 14 light switches I counted in our room. Very annoying. The lobby seating was better suited to Great Dane dogs rather than humans. If sitting one of their couches for less than 10 minutes can cause a back, maybe they should reconsider? Minimalist design need not be confusing or uncomfortable. Unfortunately at the Straf, it is both. (By the way, I am an architect who works primarily on modern, minimalist design.)
reviews.title: Too much design, not enough function

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel placed in Milan downtown is absolutely nonpareil.
reviews.title: Love Hotel

reviews.text: Rooms and suites are simply wonderful, both with the hotel design and furniture. Moreover, the location is great, just next to the Duomo cathedral (suites view is the finest).
reviews.title: Great hotel but not to clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't enjoyed food, though we joined some night events (happy hour, parties): Straf events are uniquely pleasant, with a fantastic dj set and great parterre.
reviews.title: Italian design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the best time, you will love it too!
reviews.title: Great rooms and a great staff

reviews.text: Loud obnoxious music. Well after advertised time. Would never recommend it to anyone. You can't run a disco and a hotel.
reviews.title: Don't expect to sleep here!

reviews.text: I booked the Hotel Straf simply for its location...I knew it was in the shadow of the Cathedral, across the piazza from the new Contemporary Museum, next to the Rinascente Department Store and a few steps from a metro station.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.text: I also knew it was a 'design hotel’. So I was prepared for the artistically rough cement walls in the bedroom and the copper sheeting on the floor of my bathroom.
reviews.title: Excellent location but soundproofing non-existent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But what I didn't expect to find - in fact, had almost forgotten existed - was an old-fashioned warm welcome and a genuinely friendly, helpful staff...Luca and Lorenzo at the front desk in particular.
reviews.title: Where the unconventional embraces the inconvenient
A feeling of "straf" at Hotel Straf
reviews.text: When I checked in late and hungry on the first night it was Luca who told me that the Rinascente's top floor restaurants are open every day until midnight. So I enjoyed my first Milanese meal on a terrace almost within touching distance of the spires of the Duomo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect spot to explore the city, the location couldn't be better just literally 10 steps from the Duomo square.
reviews.title: Location, location, location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Minimalist design, spotless rooms, with small areas but intelligently organized space. Quirky and small front desk, but efficient check-in/check-out process. Very hip bar at the lobby, that gets a bit crowded at night, nice to have a drink and closes relatively early so not bothering the guests.
reviews.title: Incompetent front desk, non-functional uncomfortable rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who value it, there is a well equipped gym, with new modern facilities.
reviews.title: Fabulous gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One word of advise, if you need a parking space, avoid the hotel vallet parking which charges 48€ per day, instead you can use the Rinascenti parking, just in front of the hotel and pay 50% less.
reviews.title: GalesX2

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it is a bit pricey, but has good service, comfortable room amenities, free Wi-fi, nice breakfast and a luxurious location.
reviews.title: Great design hotel in Milan

description: Hotel STRAF is located only few steps from the Duomo cathedral, the fashionable Via Montenapoleone and La Scala Opera house.An inspired fusion of Italian fashion, original design and elegance, the STRAF combines minimalist design and classic Italian architecture. The 64 rooms and suites blend design and functionality, maximising comfort. Those seeking a stylish, urban hangout will enjoy the unconventional atmosphere of the STRAF Bar and the cool service.
